Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: B3achLov3r
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Hotel for two nights in February. The biggest attraction was the price. We were pleased with the great rates and the free parking (our entire stay with 4 adults was just over $100.00)! The rooms are plain, this is not a luxury hotel, but for our purpose(we were only in the room to sleep) it was a great deal. It was clean and there was a restaurant on site - The Swiss Pick. We enjoyed a fine breakfast there and one late night dinner. The food was good and reasonably priced; service was also fine; it was not at all busy when we were there dining. If you are not looking for a high end hotel, and are focussed on functionality and economy, this is a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “If you like no functioning amenities, choose this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bev1954
Reviews.Content: If I could give this hotel less than terrible I certainly would. The wireless did not work and even speaking with their help line and the desk clerk coming to our room and fiddling with some wires, it still didn't work. We ended up "stealing" a signal from somewhere local that was unsecured. I flushed the toilet and we left for dinner. When we returned, the toilet was still running. Dinner - oh my. Well, it appeared that the Swiss Pick Restaurant attached to the hotel really wasn't too interested in having any patrons. The waitress was more concerned about setting up the tables for the New Year's Eve function the next night. She asked us if we wanted to eat or just drink. If we wanted a drink, then we could sit at the bar. I said I thought I'd like some dinner and she begrudgingly led us to a table set up for diners. When we gave our order for a draft beer and a bowl of soup for my husband and a draft beer and a salad for me, her response was, "Is that ALL?" The voice inflection was all important. I had initially wanted a bowl of French onion soup, but the chef didn't have that. I could hear him say that he was too busy making Goulash soup for the next night's big function. The Caesar was delicious, though, I must admit. When we finally gave up on trying to get the wireless internet to work, we tried to watch TV. The TV remote didn't work. We were so tired and frustrated from a LONG day of travel that we just gave up and went to bed around 8:30. The remote probably needs new batteries, but why should we have to tell them this? Where was the room maintenance and upkeep person? Now about the heat - it was either oven hot set on LOW, or cold when we turned it off. There was no comfortable setting. It seemed to be an older style wall unit type of heater. When we were checking out, the desk clerk made the mistake of asking if everything had been all right. I answered NO. Now here comes a positive remark about this hotel. She gave me 20% off the stay. Also, another positive comment I can make is that our car was not damaged after being parked in this hotel's lot for a week. Other than that, I can't think of too much positive to say about this hotel. We won't stay here again. There are so many other places in Toronto close to the airport with shuttles to the airport for us to choose from. I would say that this hotel needs some maintenance. The room overall looked old and shabby. We did save about $100 over two nights and parking our car. I guess that's a positive as well, but I still wouldn't stay here to save $50/night.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised - In a Good Way”
Reviews.Author: MuskokaTraveller32
Reviews.Content: Hotel Service was great, room was very comfortable and suit us just fine. Free shuttle to airport and free wi-fi. Bed was comfortable enough and noise was not an issue. Room was clean and had everything we needed. We also used the gym (small, but still does the trick) and the pool and jacuzzi (both very clean). This hotel is not located very close to the airport at all, but the free shuttle and free parking make it worth while. I got this deal from hotwire and I was expecting a lot less considering what I paid. Overall, it was a pleasant experience and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful place, worst Toronto Airport area hotel”
Reviews.Author: Electriques
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in the Toronto Airport area and this was the worst. Room was smelly & dirty - black stains in the carpets, big holes and rips in the sheets. Blankets looked decades old. Hallway noise was terrible, could hear people coming and going at all times of the night. Internet service was awful, you have to call the front desk for a code, which sometimes works and sometimes does not. Lots of connection issues and very, very, very slow. I pretty much gave up on any browsing of the Internet or checking of e-mails while I stayed. Elevator could be very slow so sometimes took the stairs. Useless gym that smelled awful.

Reviews.Title: “So bad!”
Reviews.Author: Rene B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really bad. It is noisy, babies crying, noise in the hallway, street noise. My room was not really clean, hole in the sheet, huge stain on the carpet. Internet did not work half the time, even after raising the issue with the front desk. Front desk staff did not answer the phone when I called, except once. Dated decor. Mattress not comfy. No choice of bed size offered or available. I really have nothing positive to say about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little more and go somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: HighStandardsYYZ
Reviews.Content: We had to find a cheap place to stay when selling our house, and we got a good rate at this hotel through hotwire. The hotel was just okay. They had updated the lobby area, which gave me hope, but the rest of the hotel seemed a little dated. The front desk clerk was more interested in her iphone than in making conversation/making us feel welcome. Kind of surly and arrogant, actually. But she got the job done, so whatever. The room was pretty tiny, the bed was small and felt shifty, the blankets had lots of rips, tears, and cigarette burns in them (classy). The pillows were awful balls of fluff. The TV didn't get very many channels. The hotel itself feels a little isolated. To use the internet you have to call down to the front desk to get a code. The first couple of codes didn't work, but the surly clerk didn't apologize or anything just kept giving us new codes in that lovely monotone voice of hers. Tried to get a bottle of Coke in the evening, but ALL of the vending machines in the hotel were not working and appeared to be vandalized or otherwise permanently broken. Had to go to the attached restaurant to purchase one can of Coke for $2.20. Insane. Again no apologies. For $12 more, we could have stayed at the DoubleTree up the road. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: mcculley
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel 2-3 times per month all year long. The staff at this hotel make this hotel !! They know you by name and are always very professional and go out of their way to make you feel at home and assist you. I like the proximity to a grocery store and mall and coffee shop. Never feel cooped up in my room on long stays.; The only negative would be that the shuttle should run every 1/2 hour on peak morning runs to the airport. Drivers are very friendly but customers are grumpy trying to get to flts on time with this new schedule!

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive,clean hotel to stay in Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: Geig6
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel on a frequent basis.I find the staff to be courteous and extremely helpful.The rooms are very clean and I have never experienced any problems whatsoever.Shuttle times to the airport are always indicated at check-in if such information is requested.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff but room is nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MariaJM1980
Reviews.Content: The room is ok sized with a nice bathroom (but we did find hairs which were not ours) The location is good for the airport. It is a 90 min bus/metro journey to Toronto town. There is a great Mandarin restaurant opposite on the same site as Staples. They have a good value lunch buffet and it is gorgeous (with good puddings/desserts) The internet did not work on the 2nd day and we had to call the provider which I do not think is right. We are paying for a service which should be provided to us. Other than that a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: littleone3009
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a Park & Fly package for our trip to Punta Cana. To start with, we originally booked online, one night stay with 2 weeks parking. The price online was $79.95. We called a week before to confirm and were informed that they would not honour that price for our package. Ended up having to pay $109.95 for one night and 1 week parking. Found out after that our friends booked the same package at the Hilton Doubletree for $10 more. Arrived to the hotel and had to wait at the desk for 10 minutes while the front desk manager ignored us and answered the phone. Finally got into our room, it was small but clean and did the job. Worst pillows I have ever slept on though. Was going to use the pool, didn't look very clean though. Shuttle in the morning was on time, but is just a big van, very crowded. We were told to call for a shuttle when we returned and they would be there in 15 minutes. Called for our pick-up on return and were told it would be at least a half hour wait. Not what you want to hear when you have been in an airport/airplane for the last 8 hours. Not worth the price at all, spend a little extra and go somewhere higher end.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Summer5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our last trip to the Toronto area. Rooms were cleaned and towels refreshed daily. Staff at front desk were friendly and helpful. We were able to take the bus to the subway for a trip downtown. There is a medium sized mall within walking distance. There was no complimentary breakfast provided. The on-site restaurant has limited breakfast selections for a reasonable price. Parking is free and abundant. Free internet service was fast and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “The Price was right!”
Reviews.Author: Salt_Water_Newfies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a stop over, so we didn't try the pool or breakfast out, but it did look decent. The staff was prompt and efficent. The price was excellent - only $62 US. The hotel itself was in good shape. The rooms where average, typical for a Comfort hotel. The shuttle was on-time picking us up to bring us back the airport. I would recommend this hotel and use it again myself for an overnight stop over, especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Staff”
Reviews.Author: FlyerHalifax
Reviews.Content: I stay here quite often for work. The new salt water pool is great! The staff are always friendly and helpful! I love the fact that they have extra coffee in the ams. It would be better if it was available until 10am rather than just until 8am though. The beds are comfortable and the rooms always very clean! It is convenient to shopping! The rates are great. It is a pleasure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: SheenaSudbury
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel after a day of shopping. The rooms were very modern, clean and comfortable. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. The pool was not open but i hear it is opening next week. Looked very nice. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Paid For, Nothing More”
Reviews.Author: Donspiel
Reviews.Content: It is what it is. Budget the whole way. A place to sleep, but there were problems. Heater in room didn't work. Pillows are hard as a rock. The staff was friendly. Didn't use the restaurant. Computer in the lobby for guest use. This is a place to stay if you are looking to save a bundle and get an old-fashioned hotel room. I would not stay here for more than a night or two tops. I stayed one night. Easy access to the highway, parking is fine and free, You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LYNN2267
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on August 24th & 25, 2008. We were going to a concert at Molson Ampitheatre and found this hotel to be reasonably close (about 12 miles) and cheap. We used a "Friends & Family" discount for Choice Hotels and got a rate of $55 per night. The hotel is less than a mile from Woodbine Racetrack (horse racing). We tried that out. It was my first experience going to the races. It was fun. Parking and entry are free. They also have slots downstairs. The Toronto Airport was about 5 miles away. You could see and hear the planes constantly. There's also a Burger King, Mc Donald's, and Harveys close by. Here are the pros and cons of this hotel: Pros: Price. Nice friendly desk staff. The room was clean and the cleaning staff did service the room again on day two which was nice. She made the bed, emptied the garbage, cleaned the bathroom, changed towels, and even offered to vacuum but we told her that was ok. The bed was a queen instead of the usual king bed but it was very comfortable. There were a lot of channels to choose from and reception was great for all of them. There were also alot of pay per view movies to choose from (12.99 - 14.99). Cons: The hotel interior is dated. The elevator was dirty (both floor and vents in ceiling). No big deal for us though. We only cared that it worked efficiently, which it did. The air conditioner in the room was very loud but worked great. The bathroom fan scared me when my husband turned it on. It was soooo loud. We couldn't leave it on because you couldn't hear the tv. The free Wireless Internet was hit and miss. Sometimes I could get right on and then other times it was impossible to get on. The pool was very small and weird shaped. The deep end was only 4 or 5 ft wide. The hot tub was fine. There was only one table with 4 chairs in the entire pool area. So if there were any more than 4 people down there at one time, you wouldn't have a place to sit. Also I did notice some mold on the pool deck. Kind of nasty. Overall it was okay. I've seen worse. Don't go expecting too much. It was worth the $55 night we spent!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Decision”
Reviews.Author: JCooper-Ontario
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at this hotel when attending a friend's wedding. We researched hotels in the area online and purchased through itravel2000.com. Honestly, we made such a good decision! The staff were so very friendly and accomodating - we asked to be on a high floor, and they put us on the top floor in a penthouse suite. The view of Toronto was beautiful. We could see many airplanes flying into Pearson Airport, but we didn't hear a one. The bed was so comfortable with lots of pillows and their was lots of space in the bathrooms for the two of us to have our things spread out. The staff were able to offer directions to where we needed to go, and they were more than willing to allow us to name our own time for our late check out. We didn't have a chance to check out the pool, which was a little disappointing. We'll have to go back to do that...soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stopover Hotel; No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Bill_NY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a single night, following a week in Mexico. My return flight arrived at nearly 2 AM, and not wanting to make an immediate three-hour drive home, I'd arranged a night at the Comfort Hotel. It was very convenient to the airport, check-in was a breeze, and my bed was clean, comfortable, with an abundance of pillows. While the bones of the building seem rather old, the lobby and rooms seem to have been updated within the past several years. When I first arrived, I helped myself to some complimentary coffee in the lobby, and on the following morning, I made a pot of coffee in the room, using the supplies provided. I was sorry that the pool/whirlpool were closed for the week (for painting) as I likely would have used them before hitting the road in the morning. The Comfort Hotel doesn't offer a lot of frills or glitz, but the price was great, and the location ideal. I will remember this hotel as a stopover option the next time I need one.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the stay.....”
Reviews.Author: stonehedge
Reviews.Content: This is as bare bones as it comes......no extras here. The best thing about this hotel is the pillows, pretty sad. The rooms are clean but very basic, 19" TV, worn out furniture, dresser had a broken drawer and the desk/table was wobbling like crazy. My husband's company put us up there and I still felt bad about staying. If you need a place to rest your weary head fine but don't be looking for anyting extra!

Reviews.Title: “Just absurd!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara-Euzebia
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s bad !! The staff is rude and indifferent, We have to wait 5 to 10 minutes to for the elevators. Electricity unstable and they gave us a room with duty toilette, and when I write duty, Iâ€™m been really polite, a shock with an 18 months baby! Very far from Toronto city, The only good thing: free parking Iâ€™m really sorry for them and for us too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Paddington6
Reviews.Content: drove to Toronto and stayed in Etobicoke, Comfort Hotel. Very nice hotel. Nearest eating strip of restaurnts is on Dixon, we passed that on our way in and had to drive back. The hotel is great and much more what I am expecting than the Clifton Hill one where we were just looking for location. Very friendly staff and their pool was very nice (colourful murals painted on the walls as well) and I had computer access while i was here in their lobby business center. There is an incredible mall across from the hotel called the Woodbine Mall. It has a Country Fair upstairs in it for the kids and you could spend easily a few hours here letting them run. It is absolutely incredible in here and well worth seeing even if you only have an hour before it closes like we did when we got there. We stumbled on it by accident when we were looking for an evening meal (which there are no good options in this mall for an family meal), but it blew us away when we saw this amusement inside a mall. We only stayed at the Comfort Hotel one night, we were here to see a show in Downtown Toronto next day and didn't want to stay in downtown and pay $25.00 to park our car. Parking was free here and we were about 20 minutes from our destination in downtown, even with the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Flop house horror”
Reviews.Author: alnog
Reviews.Content: This place is steadly going down hill. Never mind their attempts at renovations. The room seemed clean when we first arrived however the next morning, to our horror we discovered that the sheets we had been sleeping in had not been changed from the last client. There was long brown hairs , not ours, as well as 2 large red blood stains on the inside of the comforter. I nearly threw up! After alerting the front desk about this they offered to talk to the manager about possibly rebating our night. Until now no phone call or rebate. I as far as I am concerned they have lost not only any future stays from myself or family but I no longer place them in the "hotel" catagory. I rate them "Flop House 1st Class". Be warned, if you dare stay there pull apart your linens before getting in and have a good look. You may well be shocked.

Reviews.Title: “Everybody must go there!”
Reviews.Author: Axelstrophe
Reviews.Content: We've stayed 2 nights Everything was clean We got a king size bed instead of a double :D Newspaper and free coffee each morning The pool closes at 11 pm We had a car so the situation was perfect. 10 minutes drive to the Kipling subway parking which was only 5$.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: Flyskippy
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Comfort Hotel Airport North from July 29 - August 5, 2006. The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the pool is refreshing. Being located near highways that lead to Paramount Canada, Casa Loma, the Ontario Science Centre, the Royal Ontario Museum, Hockey Hall of Fame, CN Tower and the rest of downtown Toronto makes this a wonderful place to stay. Our hockey league's winner will be going to Toronto for a tournament this summer. If our team wins, I will be suggesting we stay here, as we really enjoyed it last summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: sept15girl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night on the way from Newfoundland to Florida. We found the rooms clean and the service excellent. Right across the street is Woodbine Mall, a good place for us to browse while we we waiting to go to the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I had decided to stay at this hotel for a night because of a bad experience at another hotel. We should of chose this hotel from the start. The hotel room was very clean and the staff was very friendly. This hotel comes with a gorgeous pool and jacuzzi (that was unfortunately not working at the time) and a fitness room. It's also connected to a restaurant / bar and pretty close to a mall. I had paid about $95/night last minute which was comparible to the other hotel I left the night before, whereas the other hotel didn't have 1/2 the features this one did. The wireless hi-speed internet was also very reliable I would definately stay at this hotel again the next time I'm in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn is undergoing renovation but was still an excellent place to stay. The room was roomy, comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Airport spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love the Comfort Hotel Airport in Toronto and would recommend it to anyone. It offers more than the typical Comfort Inns, but at relatively the same price. Its a great deal with friendly efficient staff, clean facilities and great location near the airport. If you're looking for airport accomodation, this is the place!

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Hotel Airport North
HotelInfo.Address: 445 Rexdale Boulevard, Toronto, Ontario M9W 6K5, Canada
